trans-unit.source: Create Storage Account
trans-unit.target: Create Storage Account

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Storage Account</languageKeyword> asynchronous operation creates a new storage account in Microsoft Azure.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Storage Account</languageKeyword> asynchronous operation creates a new storage account in Microsoft Azure.

trans-unit.source: Request
trans-unit.target: Request

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Create Storage Account</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Create Storage Account</languageKeyword> request may be specified as follows.

trans-unit.source: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID.
trans-unit.target: Replace <codeInline>%%amp;lt;subscription-id%%amp;gt;</codeInline> with your subscription ID.

trans-unit.source: Method
trans-unit.target: Method

trans-unit.source: Request URI
trans-unit.target: Request URI

trans-unit.source: POST
trans-unit.target: POST

trans-unit.source: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.
trans-unit.target: You must make sure that the request that is made to the management service is secure.

trans-unit.source: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.
trans-unit.target: For additional details, see <link xlink:href="1becb7dc-1cdc-4db4-8ae8-7e351c96c251" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Authenticating Service Management Requests</link>.

trans-unit.source: URI Parameters
trans-unit.target: URI Parameters

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Request Headers
trans-unit.target: Request Headers

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the request headers.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the request headers.

trans-unit.source: Request Header
trans-unit.target: Request Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Set this header to <userInput>application/xml</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set this header to <userInput>application/xml</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.
trans-unit.target: Specifies the version of the operation to use for this request.

trans-unit.source: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2011-06-01</userInput> or higher.
trans-unit.target: The value of this header must be set to <userInput>2011-06-01</userInput> or higher.

trans-unit.source: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about versioning headers, see <link xlink:href="bb009293-529c-4793-b925-0f8701f337d2" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Management Versioning</link>.

trans-unit.source: Request Body
trans-unit.target: Request Body

trans-unit.source: The format for the request body is as follows:
trans-unit.target: The format for the request body is as follows:

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the elements of the request body.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the elements of the request body.

trans-unit.source: Element Name
trans-unit.target: Element Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Service Name
trans-unit.target: Service Name

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: A name for the storage account that is unique within Azure.
trans-unit.target: A name for the storage account that is unique within Azure.

trans-unit.source: Storage account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.
trans-unit.target: Storage account names must be between 3 and 24 characters in length and use numbers and lower-case letters only.

trans-unit.source: This name is the DNS prefix name and can be used to access blobs, queues, and tables in the storage account.
trans-unit.target: This name is the DNS prefix name and can be used to access blobs, queues, and tables in the storage account.

trans-unit.source: For example: http://ServiceName.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/
trans-unit.target: For example: http://ServiceName.blob.core.windows.net/mycontainer/

trans-unit.source: Label
trans-unit.target: Label

trans-unit.source: Required.
trans-unit.target: Required.

trans-unit.source: A label for the storage account specified as a base64-encoded string.
trans-unit.target: A label for the storage account specified as a base64-encoded string.

trans-unit.source: The label may be up to 100 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: The label may be up to 100 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: The label can be used identify the storage account for your tracking purposes.
trans-unit.target: The label can be used identify the storage account for your tracking purposes.

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: A description for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: A description for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: The description may be up to 1024 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: Location
trans-unit.target: Location

trans-unit.source: Required if <embeddedLabel>AffinityGroup</embeddedLabel> is not specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <embeddedLabel>AffinityGroup</embeddedLabel> is not specified.

trans-unit.source: The location where the storage account is created.
trans-unit.target: The location where the storage account is created.

trans-unit.source: You can include either a <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AffinityGroup</embeddedLabel> element in the request body, but not both.
trans-unit.target: You can include either a <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AffinityGroup</embeddedLabel> element in the request body, but not both.

trans-unit.source: To list available locations, use the <link xlink:href="954b5c9f-e9ae-434f-8c13-11cd74c5d1a1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link> operation.
trans-unit.target: To list available locations, use the <link xlink:href="954b5c9f-e9ae-434f-8c13-11cd74c5d1a1" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Locations</link> operation.

trans-unit.source: AffinityGroup
trans-unit.target: AffinityGroup

trans-unit.source: Required if <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> is not specified.
trans-unit.target: Required if <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> is not specified.

trans-unit.source: The name of an existing affinity group in the specified subscription.
trans-unit.target: The name of an existing affinity group in the specified subscription.

trans-unit.source: You can include either a <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AffinityGroup</embeddedLabel> element in the request body, but not both.
trans-unit.target: You can include either a <embeddedLabel>Location</embeddedLabel> or <embeddedLabel>AffinityGroup</embeddedLabel> element in the request body, but not both.

trans-unit.source: To list available affinity groups, use the <legacyLink xlink:href="e2af3475-b0d0-407c-8252-6af8d1e22215" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Affinity Groups</legacyLink> operation.
trans-unit.target: To list available affinity groups, use the <legacyLink xlink:href="e2af3475-b0d0-407c-8252-6af8d1e22215" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">List Affinity Groups</legacyLink> operation.

trans-unit.source: GeoReplicationEnabled
trans-unit.target: GeoReplicationEnabled

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the storage account is created with the geo-replication enabled.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the storage account is created with the geo-replication enabled.

trans-unit.source: If the element is not included in the request body, the default value is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: If the element is not included in the request body, the default value is <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: If set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the data in the storage account is replicated across more than one geographic location so as to enable resilience in the face of catastrophic service loss.
trans-unit.target: If set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, the data in the storage account is replicated across more than one geographic location so as to enable resilience in the face of catastrophic service loss.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>GeoReplicationEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>GeoReplicationEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Represents the name of an extended storage account property.
trans-unit.target: Represents the name of an extended storage account property.

trans-unit.source: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.
trans-unit.target: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.

trans-unit.source: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs.
trans-unit.target: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs.

trans-unit.source: The maximum length of the Name element is 64 characters, only alphanumeric characters and underscores are valid in the Name, and the name must start with a letter.
trans-unit.target: The maximum length of the Name element is 64 characters, only alphanumeric characters and underscores are valid in the Name, and the name must start with a letter.

trans-unit.source: Attempting to use other characters, starting the Name with a non-letter character, or entering a name that is identical to that of another extended property owned by the same storage account, will result in a status code 400 (Bad Request) error.
trans-unit.target: Attempting to use other characters, starting the Name with a non-letter character, or entering a name that is identical to that of another extended property owned by the same storage account, will result in a status code 400 (Bad Request) error.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Name</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Name</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: Value
trans-unit.target: Value

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Represents the value of an extended storage account property.
trans-unit.target: Represents the value of an extended storage account property.

trans-unit.source: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.
trans-unit.target: Each extended property must have both a defined name and value.

trans-unit.source: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs, and each extended property value has a maximum length of 255 characters.
trans-unit.target: You can have a maximum of 50 extended property name/value pairs, and each extended property value has a maximum length of 255 characters.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Value</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Value</embeddedLabel> element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: SecondaryReadEnabled
trans-unit.target: SecondaryReadEnabled

trans-unit.source: Optional.
trans-unit.target: Optional.

trans-unit.source: Indicates that secondary read is enabled for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: Indicates that secondary read is enabled for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>SecondaryReadEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>SecondaryReadEnabled</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2013-11-01 or higher and is replaced by the AccountType element with version 2014-06-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: AccountType
trans-unit.target: AccountType

trans-unit.source: Specifies whether the account supports locally-redundant storage, geo-redundant storage, zone-redundant storage, or read access geo-redundant storage.
trans-unit.target: Specifies whether the account supports locally-redundant storage, geo-redundant storage, zone-redundant storage, or read access geo-redundant storage.

trans-unit.source: Possible values are:
trans-unit.target: Possible values are:

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>AccountType</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher and it replaces the SecondaryReadEnabled and GeoReplicationEnabled elements.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>AccountType</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-06-01 or higher and it replaces the SecondaryReadEnabled and GeoReplicationEnabled elements.

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>Premium_LRS</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>Premium_LRS</languageKeyword> element is only available using version 2014-10-01 or higher.

trans-unit.source: A <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword> account cannot be changed to another account type later, and the other account types cannot be changed to <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: A <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword> account cannot be changed to another account type later, and the other account types cannot be changed to <languageKeyword>Standard_ZRS</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The same goes for <embeddedLabel>Premium_LRS</embeddedLabel> accounts.
trans-unit.target: The same goes for <embeddedLabel>Premium_LRS</embeddedLabel> accounts.

trans-unit.source: Response
trans-unit.target: Response

trans-unit.source: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.
trans-unit.target: The response includes an HTTP status code, a set of response headers, and a response body.

trans-unit.source: Status Code
trans-unit.target: Status Code

trans-unit.source: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).
trans-unit.target: A successful operation returns status code 200 (OK).

trans-unit.source: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.
trans-unit.target: For information about status codes, see <link xlink:href="10f8d244-4649-4063-b6c9-7a20765513fa" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Status and Error Codes</link>.

trans-unit.source: Response Headers
trans-unit.target: Response Headers

trans-unit.source: The response for this operation includes the following headers.
trans-unit.target: The response for this operation includes the following headers.

trans-unit.source: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.
trans-unit.target: The response may also include additional standard HTTP headers.

trans-unit.source: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: All standard headers conform to the <externalLink><linkText>HTTP/1.1 protocol specification</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=150478</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Response Header
trans-unit.target: Response Header

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.
trans-unit.target: A value that uniquely identifies a request made against the management service.

trans-unit.source: For an asynchronous operation, you can call <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.
trans-unit.target: For an asynchronous operation, you can call <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> with the value of the header to determine whether the operation is complete, has failed, or is still in progress.

trans-unit.source: Response Body
trans-unit.target: Response Body

trans-unit.source: None.
trans-unit.target: None.

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: You can create storage accounts programmatically with the <embeddedLabel>Create Storage Account</embeddedLabel> operation, up to the limits available in your subscription.
trans-unit.target: You can create storage accounts programmatically with the <embeddedLabel>Create Storage Account</embeddedLabel> operation, up to the limits available in your subscription.

trans-unit.source: For information about the limits related to storage accounts, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/azure-subscription-service-limits/#storagelimits</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For information about the limits related to storage accounts, see <externalLink><linkText>Azure Subscription and Service Limits, Quotas, and Constraints</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/articles/azure-subscription-service-limits/#storagelimits</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: The operation returns immediately with a request ID, while the storage account creation is performed asynchronously by Azure, because provisioning a new storage account can take several minutes.
trans-unit.target: The operation returns immediately with a request ID, while the storage account creation is performed asynchronously by Azure, because provisioning a new storage account can take several minutes.

trans-unit.source: To find out when the storage account creation operation has completed, you can poll the <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> operation with the request ID.
trans-unit.target: To find out when the storage account creation operation has completed, you can poll the <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> operation with the request ID.

trans-unit.source: This returns an XML body with an <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> element containing a <embeddedLabel>Status</embeddedLabel> element which will have a value of <codeInline>InProgress</codeInline>, <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, or <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline>, depending on the status of the storage account creation.
trans-unit.target: This returns an XML body with an <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> element containing a <embeddedLabel>Status</embeddedLabel> element which will have a value of <codeInline>InProgress</codeInline>, <codeInline>Failed</codeInline>, or <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline>, depending on the status of the storage account creation.

trans-unit.source: If you poll until the status is <codeInline>Failed</codeInline> or <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline>, the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> element will contain a status code in the <embeddedLabel>StatusCode</embeddedLabel> element, and failed operations will contain additional error information in the <embeddedLabel>Error</embeddedLabel> element.
trans-unit.target: If you poll until the status is <codeInline>Failed</codeInline> or <codeInline>Succeeded</codeInline>, the <embeddedLabel>Operation</embeddedLabel> element will contain a status code in the <embeddedLabel>StatusCode</embeddedLabel> element, and failed operations will contain additional error information in the <embeddedLabel>Error</embeddedLabel> element.

trans-unit.source: The information in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn249410.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> may also help you when planning your storage needs.
trans-unit.target: The information in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Storage Scalability and Performance Targets</linkText><linkUri>http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/azure/dn249410.aspx</linkUri></externalLink> may also help you when planning your storage needs.

trans-unit.source: Example
trans-unit.target: Example

trans-unit.source: This example console program creates a new storage account, setting the description, label, location, and geo-replication state using the <embeddedLabel>Create Storage Account</embeddedLabel> operation, then polls the <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> operation with the request ID returned from the <embeddedLabel>Create Storage Account</embeddedLabel> operation until the call has succeeded, failed, or polling has timed out.
trans-unit.target: This example console program creates a new storage account, setting the description, label, location, and geo-replication state using the <embeddedLabel>Create Storage Account</embeddedLabel> operation, then polls the <link xlink:href="1215ece5-cbef-4a85-a3db-ab6c20c2c6df" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Operation Status</link> operation with the request ID returned from the <embeddedLabel>Create Storage Account</embeddedLabel> operation until the call has succeeded, failed, or polling has timed out.

trans-unit.source: Finally, it calls <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> to display the properties for the new storage account.
trans-unit.target: Finally, it calls <link xlink:href="06de06a9-3363-4c03-8a99-3fbaf761642c" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Get Storage Account Properties</link> to display the properties for the new storage account.

trans-unit.source: Set the value for the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header in the <codeInline>Version</codeInline> string, your subscription identifier in <codeInline>SubscriptionId</codeInline>, your management certificate thumbprint in <codeInline>Thumbprint</codeInline>, and set ServiceName to a unique storage account name to run the sample.
trans-unit.target: Set the value for the <parameterReference>x-ms-version</parameterReference> header in the <codeInline>Version</codeInline> string, your subscription identifier in <codeInline>SubscriptionId</codeInline>, your management certificate thumbprint in <codeInline>Thumbprint</codeInline>, and set ServiceName to a unique storage account name to run the sample.

trans-unit.source: This example program produces console output something like the following when run:
trans-unit.target: This example program produces console output something like the following when run:
